aaanalysis.plot_legendÔÉÅ

aaanalysis.plot_legend(ax=None, dict_color=None, list_cat=None, labels=None, loc='upper left', loc_out=False, y=None, x=None, ncol=3, labelspacing=0.2, columnspacing=1.0, handletextpad=0.8, handlelength=2, fontsize=None, fontsize_title=None, weight='normal', fontsize_weight='normal', marker=None, marker_size=10, lw=0, linestyle=None, edgecolor=None, hatch=None, hatchcolor='white', title=None, title_align_left=True, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Sets an independntly customizable plot legend.

Legends can be flexbily adjusted based categories and colors provided in dict_color dictionary. This functions comprises the most convinient settings for func:`matplotlib.pyplot.legend.

Parameters:

  • ax (Optional[Axes]) ‚Äì The axes to attach the legend to. If not provided, the current axes will be used.

  • dict_color (Optional[Dict[str, str]]) ‚Äì A dictionary mapping categories to colors.

  • list_cat (Optional[List[str]]) ‚Äì List of categories to include in the legend (keys of dict_color).

  • labels (Optional[List[str]]) ‚Äì Labels for legend items corresponding to given categories.

  • loc (Union[str, int]) ‚Äì Location for the legend.

  • loc_out (bool) ‚Äì If True, sets automatically x=0 and y=-0.25 if they are None.

  • y (Union[int, float, None]) ‚Äì The y-coordinate for the legend‚Äôs anchor point.

  • x (Union[int, float, None]) ‚Äì The x-coordinate for the legend‚Äôs anchor point.

  • ncol (int) ‚Äì Number of columns in the legend, at least 1.

  • labelspacing (Union[int, float]) ‚Äì Vertical spacing between legend items.

  • columnspacing (Union[int, float]) ‚Äì Horizontal spacing between legend columns.

  • handletextpad (Union[int, float]) ‚Äì Horizontal spacing bewtween legend handle (marker) and label.

  • handlelength (Union[int, float]) ‚Äì Length of legend handle.

  • fontsize (Union[int, float, None]) ‚Äì Font size for the legend text.

  • fontsize_title (Union[int, float, None]) ‚Äì Font size for the legend title.

  • weight (str) ‚Äì Weight of the font.

  • fontsize_weight (str) ‚Äì Font weight for the legend title.

  • marker (Union[str, int, list, None]) ‚Äì Marker for legend items. Lines (‚Äò-‚Äô) only visiable if lw>0.

  • marker_size (Union[int, float, List[Union[int, float]]]) ‚Äì Marker size for legend items.

  • lw (Union[int, float]) ‚Äì Line width for legend items. If negative, corners are rounded.

  • linestyle (Union[str, list, None]) ‚Äì Style of line. Only applied to lines (marker='-').

  • edgecolor (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Edge color of legend items. Not applicable to lines.

  • hatch (Union[str, List[str], None]) ‚Äì Filling pattern for default marker. Only applicable when marker=None.

  • hatchcolor (str) ‚Äì Hatch color of legend items. Only applicable when marker=None.

  • title (Optional[str]) ‚Äì Title for the legend.

  • title_align_left (bool) ‚Äì Whether to align the title to the left.

  • **kwargs ‚Äì Furhter key word arguments for matplotlib.axes.Axes.legend.

Returns:

Axes on which legend is applied to.

Return type:

ax

Examples

>>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
>>> import seaborn as sns
>>> import aaanalysis as aa
>>> data = {'Classes': ['A', 'B', 'C'], 'Values': [23, 27, 43]}
>>> colors = aa.plot_get_clist()
>>> aa.plot_settings()
>>> sns.barplot(x='Classes', y='Values', data=data, palette=colors, hatch=["/", ".", "."], hue="Classes", legend=False)
>>> sns.despine()
>>> dict_color = {"Group 1": "black", "Group 2": "black"}
>>> aa.plot_legend(dict_color=dict_color, ncol=2, y=1.1, hatch=["/", "."])
>>> plt.tight_layout()
>>> plt.show()

Notes

Markers can be None (default), lines (‚Äò-‚Äô) or one of the matplotlib markers.
